com.thinkaurelius.titan.diskstorage

Class BackendTransaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thinkaurelius.titan.diskstorage.BackendTransaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TransactionHandle

    public class BackendTransaction
extends Object
implements TransactionHandle
    Bundles all transaction handles from the various backend systems and provides a proxy for some of their methods for convenience. Also increases robustness of read call by attempting read calls multiple times on failure.
    Author:
    Matthias Broecheler (me@matthiasb.com)

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: TransactionHandle
        Commits the transaction. This implies a TransactionHandle.flush(). Call either this method or TransactionHandle.rollback() at most once per instance.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface TransactionHandle
        Throws:
        StorageException

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
              throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: TransactionHandle
        Aborts (or rolls back) the transaction. Call either this method or TransactionHandle.commit() at most once per instance.
        Specified by:
        rollback in interface TransactionHandle
        Throws:
        StorageException

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: TransactionHandle
        Forces all buffered writes to be sent to underlying storage. It is not necessary or meaningful to call this method on a TransactionHandle instance after calling TransactionHandle.commit() or TransactionHandle.rollback() on the instance.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface TransactionHandle
        Throws:
        StorageException

      • mutateEdges

        public void mutateEdges(StaticBuffer key,
               List<Entry> additions,
               List<StaticBuffer> deletions)
                 throws StorageException
        Applies the specified insertion and deletion mutations on the edge store to the provided key. Both, the list of additions or deletions, may be empty or NULL if there is nothing to be added and/or deleted.
        Parameters:
        key - Key
        additions - List of entries (column + value) to be added
        deletions - List of columns to be removed
        Throws:
        StorageException

      • acquireEdgeLock

        public void acquireEdgeLock(StaticBuffer key,
                   StaticBuffer column,
                   StaticBuffer expectedValue)
                     throws StorageException
        Acquires a lock for the key-column pair on the edge store which ensures that nobody else can take a lock on that respective entry for the duration of this lock (but somebody could potentially still overwrite the key-value entry without taking a lock). The expectedValue defines the value expected to match the value at the time the lock is acquired (or null if it is expected that the key-column pair does not exist).

        If this method is called multiple times with the same key-column pair in the same transaction, all but the first invocation are ignored.

        The lock has to be released when the transaction closes (commits or aborts).

        Parameters:
        key - Key on which to lock
        column - Column the column on which to lock
        expectedValue - The expected value for the specified key-column pair on which to lock. Null if it is expected that the pair does not exist
        Throws:
        StorageException

      • acquireVertexIndexLock

        public void acquireVertexIndexLock(StaticBuffer key,
                          StaticBuffer column,
                          StaticBuffer expectedValue)
                            throws StorageException
        Acquires a lock for the key-column pair on the property index which ensures that nobody else can take a lock on that respective entry for the duration of this lock (but somebody could potentially still overwrite the key-value entry without taking a lock). The expectedValue defines the value expected to match the value at the time the lock is acquired (or null if it is expected that the key-column pair does not exist).

        If this method is called multiple times with the same key-column pair in the same transaction, all but the first invocation are ignored.

        The lock has to be released when the transaction closes (commits or aborts).

        Parameters:
        key - Key on which to lock
        column - Column the column on which to lock
        expectedValue - The expected value for the specified key-column pair on which to lock. Null if it is expected that the pair does not exist
        Throws:
        StorageException
